item.title: 【Securing the Model Context Protocol (MCP): New AI Security Risks in Agentic Workflows】确保模型上下文协议（MCP）：代理工作流程中的新AI安全风险
item.description:
【

The Model Context Protocol (MCP), introduced in late 2024, is a significant move forward towards transforming the agentic AI revolution by providing a mechanism for them to connect with enterprise tools, APIs, and databases. The protocol presents a standardized way for large language models (LLMs) and business workflows to communicate with business systems, databases, APIs, and even development environments. Just as Open Database Connectivity (ODBC) standardized access to databases, MCP offers a standard way for AI agents to interact with data and applications across an enterprise. 

However, as MCP is adopted across organizations, we are also seeing the introduction of new types of security risks that did not exist before. The same abilities that make MCP so powerful, such as bidirectional communication, agentic features, tool descriptions, etc., all introduce a new threat landscape that cybersecurity professionals may not be ready for.

】

模型上下文协议（MCP） ，在 2024年末 中引入的 ，是向转换转换通过为它们提供与企业工具相关的机制来转换 pastect 的范围 paste 对于大型语言模型（LLM）和业务工作流程，以与业务系统，数据库，API甚至开发环境进行通信。就像开放数据库连接（ODBC）对数据库的标准化访问一样，MCP也为AI代理与跨企业进行与数据和应用程序进行交互的标准方法。 

然而，如 MCP在整个组织中都采用了MCP ，我们还看到了以前不存在的新型安全风险的引入。同样的能力使MCP如此强大，例如双向交流，代理功能，工具描述等，都引入了一个新的威胁景观，网络安全专业人员可能无法做好准备。

item.title: 【Testing Updates in Insert-Only Ledger Tables and Understanding Updates in Updatable Ledger Tables】在仅插入分类帐中的测试更新，并了解更新的分类帐表中的更新
item.description:
【

In SQL Server, ledger tables offer powerful tamper-evident functionality, which is essential for systems that require high levels of trust and auditability. Two distinct types serve different needs: insert-only ledger tables and updatable ledger tables. Insert-only tables enforce strict immutability, allowing data to be added but never altered or deleted, making them ideal for transaction logs or event sourcing.

Conversely, updatable ledger tables permit modifications and deletions while meticulously maintaining a cryptographically verifiable history of all changes, much like a blockchain. This article provides a hands-on demonstration of these principles. We will test update operations against insert-only tables to confirm their constraints and then explore how updates are seamlessly and transparently managed in updatable ledger tables, complete with practical examples.

】

在SQL Server中，分类帐桌提供了功能强大的篡改功能，这对于需要高水平的信任和可审核性的系统至关重要。两种不同的类型满足不同的需求：仅插入分类账表和可更新的分类帐表。仅插入表可执行严格的不可超数性，允许添加数据但从未更改或删除数据，使其非常适合交易日志或事件采购。

相反，可更新的分类账表可以修改和删除，同时精心维护所有更改的密码可验证的历史记录，就像区块链一样。本文提供了这些原则的动手演示。我们将针对仅插入表测试更新操作，以确认其约束，然后探索如何在可更新的分类帐表中无缝和透明地管理更新，并提供实际示例。

item.title: 【Infrastructure as Code (IaC) in a Multi-Cloud Environment: Consistency and Security Issues】在多云环境中作为代码（IAC）的基础架构：一致性和安全问题
item.description:
【

Relevance of the Study

Modern organizations are increasingly turning to cloud technologies to improve the flexibility, scalability, and efficiency of their IT infrastructure. One important tool in this process is Infrastructure as Code (IaC), which allows organizations to describe their infrastructure using code, automate the deployment process, reduce the risk of human error, and ensure consistency across different stages of the application lifecycle.

In addition, there is a trend towards multi-cloud architectures, where companies use multiple cloud providers to spread the load, improve fault tolerance, and comply with security and data localization regulations. This approach allows organizations to take advantage of the benefits of different cloud providers while minimizing the risks associated with a single provider.

】

研究的相关性

现代组织越来越多地转向云技术，以提高其IT基础架构的灵活性，可扩展性和效率。此过程中的一个重要工具是基础架构作为代码（IAC），它允许组织使用代码来描述其基础架构，自动化部署过程，减少人为错误的风险，并确保应用程序生命周期的不同阶段的一致性。

。

此外，多云体系结构有一种趋势，在该架构中，公司使用多个云提供商来扩大负载，提高容错的承受能力，并遵守安全性和数据本地化规定。这种方法使组织可以利用不同云提供商的好处，同时最大程度地减少与单个提供商相关的风险。

item.title: 【Unpack IPTables: Its Inner Workings With Commands and Demos】打开iptables：它的内部运作，带有命令和演示
item.description:
【

We all know that the internet works by sending and receiving small chunks of data called packets. Back in the early days, when the internet was still in its infancy, packets were allowed to transfer freely across a connected world, however small that world was. Anyone could send packets to your system, and you could send packets to other connected systems. All services running on systems were exposed by default. 

As the internet started to grow, problems started to emerge, problems related to security. There are worms, viruses, unauthorized access, denial-of-service (DoS) attacks, IP spoofing, etc. Iptables is an attempt to deal with some of these problems.

】

我们都知道，互联网是通过发送和接收数据包的少量数据来工作的。早期，当互联网仍处于起步阶段时，允许包装包在一个连接的世界中自由转移，无论世界多么小。任何人都可以将数据包发送到您的系统，您可以将数据包发送到其他连接的系统。默认情况下，所有在系统上运行的服务均已公开。 

随着互联网开始增长，问题开始出现，与安全有关。有蠕虫，病毒，未经授权的访问，拒绝服务（DOS）攻击，IP欺骗等。Iptables是一种尝试处理其中一些问题的尝试。
